# fillShader

**Instance Property**

A custom shader used to determine the color of the filled portion of the shape node.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var fillShader: SKShader? { get set }
```

```swift
var fillShader: SKShader? { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is `nil`. If a `fillShader` is specified, when the shape node is drawn, the shader is used to determine the output colors for any part of the shape node that’s fillled. SpriteKit implements many fill features using a default shader, such as:

- Fill color.
- Animations on [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/alpha].
- Light cast by [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKLightNode].

If you supply a custom value for `fillShader`, your custom shader overrides the default shader which neutralizes the default features. It is the responsibility of your custom fillShader to implement any of the features your shape requires.

## Customizing Stroking or Fill Drawing

- **Controlling Shape Drawing with Shaders**: Change a shape node’s appearance by supplying custom shader code.
- **strokeShader**: A custom shader used to determine the color of the stroked portion of the shape node.
- **attributeValues**: The values of each attribute associated with the node’s attached shader.
- **setValue(_:forAttribute:)**: Sets an attribute value for an attached shader.
- **value(forAttributeNamed:)**: The value of a shader attribute.
